Job Title: Senior Power Platform Developer

Location: Portland, OR

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
About Us:

Dynalectric Oregon has served the specialized electrical needs of the Pacific Northwest for over 80 years. We have consistently maintained a local and personalized focus while growing into one of the foremost electrical contractors in the state. As a multidisciplinary electrical firm, Dynalectric Oregon has the in-house expertise to plan, construct, install, and fully integrate every component related to electrical, controls, and telecommunications systems. Our ability to perform projects collaboratively - under one roof - helps lower costs, increases accuracy, and improves project communications.

For more information, please visit www.dyna-oregon.com

Job Title: Senior Power Platform Developer

Job Summary:

Dynalectric-Oregon is seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Power Platform Developer to join our dynamic team. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, we are embarking on an exciting journey to enhance our business operations and processes using Microsoft’s Power Platform. As our first dedicated Power Platform Developer you will be a key contributor in transforming and optimizing company-wide operations from a foundational level.

The Senior Power Platform Developer at Dynalectric will be responsible for the entire development lifecycle within the Microsoft Power Platform environment, including:

Conducting user interviewsCreating Requirements SpecificationsApplication Design, build & iterationImplementation & MaintenanceSupport and troubleshooting for all applications, automations & dashboards

The successful candidate will work closely with all business units across company, leveraging their expertise to create seamless solutions that connect our business processes and bridge gaps between our overhead operations and the electrical installation work carried out on the jobsite. The ability to effectively and humbly communicate and collaborate toward successful solutions with others is required.

Duties and responsibilities:

Design and Development

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into effective Power Platform solutions.Develop custom applications, automations, and dashboards using the Microsoft Power Platform; primarily Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI.

Implementation and Integration

Work with stakeholders through the implementation of Power Platform tools, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems and processes.Utilize Role-Based Access Control to safeguard data and facilitate scalable access management.Work closely with IT and other departments to troubleshoot and resolve integration issues.

Iteration and Improvement

Continuously iterate on Power Platform solutions to enhance functionality and user experience.Create collaborative relationships with stakeholders to identify areas for operational improvements and implement/rollout changes to meet evolving business needs.

Service and Support

Provide ongoing support for Power Platform applications, addressing user issues, bugs, and system errors promptly.Build and maintain supportive relationships with end-users to gather feedback and make necessary adjustments to optimize performance.

Training and Growth

Spearhead the development of training materials and methods for educating end-users on the proper use of these newly developed tools.Seek opportunities to train others and grow a robust Power Platform Development team.

Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Power Platform Developer, with a demonstrable portfolio of successful projects.Advanced knowledge of Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Power Query.Proficient in Microsoft 365 suite and related technologies.Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Exceptional communication and collaboration skills.Experience working with various data sources including SharePoint, Microsoft Dataverse, Excel and Smartsheet.

Education and Experience: 

4+ years of experience in Power Platform development.Demonstrated experience and a track record of success in lieu of formal education is acceptable.Relevant certifications in Microsoft Power Platform are advantageous.Competency integrating Power Platform solutions with other tech stack solutions such as Viewpoint Vista, Starbuilder, and Smartsheets.Real world SDLC experience strongly preferred (simultaneous EOL/phase out & new solution implementation of particular interest).Understanding of the commercial construction industry is preferred (electrical trade knowledge/field experience a plus).Understanding and competency leveraging APIs is also valued but not mandatory.

Working Conditions:

Primarily Office-based with occasional trips to job sites for in-person coordination, collaboration, training, and educational objectives. Monday – Friday during normal business hours.

Benefits:

Health & Welfare (medical, dental & vision)401(k)401(k) matchPaid time offPaid holidaysFlexible spending accountsLife insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance program

We offer our employees a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package and are always looking for individuals with the talent and skills required to contribute to our continued growth and success. Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

#dynor

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
